articles.title: Suspect in Charlie Kirk Assassination Arrested; Political Fallout Continues
articles.description: Tyler Robinson, 22, has been arrested in connection with the assassination of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. His family reportedly aided authorities in his apprehension. The incident has triggered widespread political reactions and discussions about political violence, with calls for peaceful responses from various figures, including former President Trump. [2, 3, 5, 6, 8, 11, 13, 14]

articles.title: Sushila Karki Sworn In as Nepal's First Woman Interim Prime Minister
articles.description: Following a week of violent protests and the collapse of the previous government, former Supreme Court Chief Justice Sushila Karki has been sworn in as Nepal's interim Prime Minister. She is the first woman to hold the position and has pledged to address the protesters' demands for an end to corruption. [1, 2, 3, 8]

articles.title: Israeli Strikes Kill Dozens in Gaza Amid Continued Displacement and Malnutrition Crisis
articles.description: Israeli forces have continued their strikes in Gaza City, leading to dozens of fatalities and the displacement of thousands of people. The Gaza Ministry of Health reported additional deaths from malnutrition, bringing the total from starvation to 420, including 145 children, since the conflict began. [12]
